page.title: 12People - village
page.content: The families living on the edge of Church Fenton village have papers and mail delivered daily and milk every other day. There is a shop and a Post Office half a mile away and a mobile butcher,fishmonger and baker call twice a week and a library once a week. However most families have a car and travel to York,Leeds or Selby for their main shopping. Many people grow their own vegetables and have fruit trees in their gardens. The older generation are pleased to have a daily visit from a warden paid by the local authority. A meals-on-wheels service is run twice a week by volunteers with meals provided by the canteen at British Gypsum in Sherburn. The doctor holds a weekly surgery in the village for those who can't travel to Sherburn.
